item.title: Report E-2025010070
item.description:
Report E-2025010070

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Sun Country Airlines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FEAM CVG currently operates as contract maintenance for Sun Country Airlines at the CVG airport. On 12/20/2024 Sun Country maintenance control reached out to a FEAM employee to request that a non-hazardous material aircraft part be shipped back to MSP that night as COMAT on board flight 3039 and A/C N7907A. Without the knowledge or consultation of any Sun Country employee the FEAM employee also loaded a single portable halon fire extinguisher (UN1044) which was not declared as hazmat. This undeclared hazmat COMAT was subsequently onboard A/C N7907A for flight 3039 from CVG to MSP. Upon arrival in MSP this hazmat was discovered, and the discrepancy became known. There was no package failure or release of material during this event and the undeclared hazmat package was removed from the aircraft without further incident. Actions taken after this event included reaching out to the contract maintenance provider to remind them any shipping of items as COMAT needs to be communicated too and cleared by the Sun Country materials department. An internal investigation was also launched along with the filing of an FAA hazmat cargo discrepancy report and an FAA VDRP related to the regulatory violation that occurred.

item.title: Report E-2025010013
item.description:
Report E-2025010013

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-31
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 31, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon bottles of UN1760 were forked and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools, neutralizing agent, and absorbents to collect all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010035
item.description:
Report E-2025010035

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material/PPE and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010019
item.description:
Report E-2025010019

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum that arrived from the customer damaged by a forklift that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drum. One (1) 65 gallons poly drum was used to containerize the original drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025010051
item.description:
Report X-2025010051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-28
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, INTERCEPTION OF TWO AIR PACKAGES WAS MADE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED TWO LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS, 38.5 WH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN CALIFORNIA, USA IS 1ZH9199D1203548932. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGES WERE FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MIA TO SDF.
